member.summary: Creates and returns a new bitmap image of the represented range or shape using PixelFormat.Bgra32.

member.remarks: This brush has meaning in cases where ranges and shapes use fills and lines that include some level of transparency.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.UIManager.CreateCustomControl(SpreadsheetGear.Shapes.IShape)
member.summary: Returns the FrameworkElement to use in place of the specified autoshape or null if the default autoshape should be used.
member.param: Specifies the shape in question; check the ID or Name property to distinguish one shape from another.

remarks.para: Override this method to provide a custom replacement for an autoshape. Worksheet form controls such as checkboxes cannot be replaced.
The control will be disposed of as soon as it is scrolled out of view and CreateCustomControl will be called again if it is scrolled back into view.

member.summary: Specifies that the fourth pane is to be used.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.RangeLocationFlags.Headers
member.summary: Specifies that row and column headers are to be considered. A row or column value of -1 is used for headers.

member.name: F:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.RangeLocationFlags.Outlines
member.summary: Specifies that outlines are to be considered. A row or column value of -2 is used for outlines.

member.name: T:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView
member.summary: Provides a fully functional spreadsheet control which supports rich functionality including familiar keyboard and mouse selections, in-cell editing, a FormulaBar control, goto, cut, copy, paste, clear, undo, redo, printing, interruptible background calculation, real time workbook updates, multiple workbooks, DisplayReference, WorkbookDesigner, WorkbookExplorer, RangeExplorer, ChartExplorer, ShapeExplorer and more.

remarks.para: The WorkbookView control adheres to the standard WPF threading model. Accessing any members of a WorkbookView must be done from the thread which created the WorkbookView.
For important information about the threading model of SpreadsheetGear see and .

To modify the workbook(s) associated with a WorkbookView at design time, right click on the WorkbookView and select Workbook Designer. From the Workbook Designer, you can open, edit, format, save and close workbooks. The workbooks which are left open in the Workbook Designer when the designer is closed will be saved with the form containing the WorkbookView, and will be loaded into the workbook set associated with the WorkbookView when the form is created at run time.
The , , , and properties are the most commonly used workbook view properties.

Use the and properties to control which workbook or which worksheet ranges are displayed in the workbook view. The DisplayReference property provides the ability to display multiple workbooks in a single workbook view control, as well as the ability to limit what the user of the workbook view control is able to see.
The , and events are the most commonly used workbook view events.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.#ctor(SpreadsheetGear.IWorkbook)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a control with the specified workbook.
member.param: The workbook to view in the control.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.BeginEdit
member.summary: Puts the active cell or selected textbox in edit mode.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CancelEdit
member.summary: Cancels edit mode and discards any changes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.EndEdit
member.summary: Ends edit mode and commits any changes.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Interrupts background calculation if necessary, acquires an exclusive lock on the workbook set associated with this , and suspends painting and events until is called.

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.
See for more information.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.EndUpdate
member.summary: Restores painting and events to the state they were in before the last call to , releases the lock acquired by BeginUpdate, and starts background calculation if appropriate.

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.
See for more information.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.Cut
member.summary: Cut the contents of the current selection to the clipboard.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.Copy
member.summary: Copy the contents of the current selection to the clipboard.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.Paste
member.summary: Paste the clipboard contents to the current selection.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.PasteSpecial(SpreadsheetGear.PasteType,SpreadsheetGear.PasteOperation,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Paste the clipboard contents to the current selection using the specified options.
member.param: Specifies what to paste.
Specifies how to combine values.
Specifies whether blanks in the source range should be skipped (formatted cells with no data are considered blank cells).
Specifies whether data should be transposed in the destination.

member.summary: Interrupts background calculation if necessary and acquires an exclusive lock on the workbook set associated with this .

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.

member.summary: Releases a lock acquired with and starts background calculation if appropriate.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RewindLock(System.Int32)
member.summary: Interrupts background calculation if necessary and restores locks to the state they were in before was called.

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.
See for more information.

member.param: The rewind count acquired from .

member.summary: Unwinds the locks for the workbook set associated with this workbook view.
member.returns: The rewind count which must be passed to .

remarks.para: The control adheres to the standard Windows Forms threading model. Calls to this method must be made from the thread which created the WorkbookView.

member.param: The horizontal screen coordinate of the column to find.
The vertical screen coordinate of the row to find.

member.param: Specifies the horizontal screen coordinate of the column to find.

Returns the fractional zero based row.
Returns the fractional zero based column.
Specifies which pane to use and whether to include row and column headers and outlines in the calculations.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeToLocation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Returns the screen coordinates of the fractional zero based row and columns.
member.param: Specifies the fractional zero based row.
Specifies the fractional zero based column.
Returns the horizontal screen coordinate (could be a very large positive or negative number if the column is far away from the currently displayed columns).
Returns the vertical screen coordinate (could be a very large positive or negative number if the row is far away from the currently displayed rows).

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeToLocation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@,SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.RangeLocationFlags)
member.summary: Returns the screen coordinates of the fractional zero based row and columns.
member.param: Specifies the fractional zero based row or -1 for the header or -2 for the outline.
Specifies the fractional zero based column or -1 for the header or -2 for the outline.
Returns the horizontal screen coordinate (could be a very large positive or negative number if the column is far away from the currently displayed columns).
Returns the vertical screen coordinate (could be a very large positive or negative number if the row is far away from the currently displayed rows).
Specifies which pane to use and whether to include row and column headers and outlines in the calculations.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CheckLayoutActive
member.summary: This method is called from the Active properties or when GUI event code needs things to be laid out such as KeyHandler and MouseHandler. It onlys lays out what is necessary for the public API's and events to work properly and makes sure the control is initialized.

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CheckLayoutActiveWithLock
member.summary: This method gets a lock if necessary before calling CheckLayoutActive().

member.name: M:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CheckLayoutDisplay
member.summary: Checks to see that WorkbookViewTab's are laid out correctly when either default or custom tabs are being used. If default tabs are being used and we do not have a current workbook, we use the first workbook we can find in the WorkbookSet, but only if DisplaySupported is true. The WorkbookDesigner turns this property off so we don't use another workbook after closing.

members.member:
Gets or sets the property which specifies whether background calculation is enabled for the workbook set.
See , , and for more information.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.DisplayReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which specifies which workbook or set of cell ranges to display in the workbook view.

remarks.para: Use the DisplayReference property to specify what should be displayed for each "sheet tab" of the workbook view control.

takes a comma separated list of formulas which must return a range. These formulas are evaluated each time a calculation completes in the workbook set associated with the workbook view control, by calling the method of the first worksheet of the first workbook of the workbook set.
Examples of valid settings for DisplayReference include:

list.item: "" displays the first workbook of the workbook set.
"A1:C3" displays the range A1:C3 from the first worksheet of the first workbook.

"[Book1]Sheet1!A1:C3, Book2!MyName" displays the range A1:C3 from the worksheet "Sheet1" of the workbook "Book1" on the first "sheet tab", and displays the range referred to by the defined name "MyName" of workbook "Book2" on the second sheet tab.
"INDIRECT([Book1]Sheet1!A1)" displays the range referred to by the text in the cell A1 of the worksheet "Sheet1" of the workbook "Book1".

remarks.para: Use the property to specify the text to display on each "sheet tab".

summary.para: Gets or sets the property which specifies the text to display on each of the "sheet tabs" of the workbook view.

remarks.para: Use the property in conjunction with the property to specify the text to display on the "sheet tabs" of the workbook view control.
The names are specified as a comma separated list of formulas which return the text to display. Some valid examples include:

list.item: "\"MySheet1\", \"MySheet2\"" displays "MySheet1" on the first sheet tab and "MySheet2" on the second sheet tab.
"[Book1]Sheet1!A1" displays the text in the cell A1 on the first sheet tab.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.FormulaBar
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula bar associated with this workbook view.

remarks.para: The formula bar will automatically connect to the active WorkbookView control contained within the same container. Use this property to set a direct link to any formula bar.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.HollowSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets the property which determines whether selections are painted with a hollow interior. If this property is set to true then only the border of the selected range will be painted.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.IsEditing
member.summary: Gets the property which specifies whether the control is currently in edit mode.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected range.

member.name: P:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ShapeSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets the selected shape range.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ActiveTabChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the active tab changes.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ActiveTabChanging
member.summary: Occurs when the user is attempting to change the active tab and provides the ability to cancel the change.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.Calculate
member.summary: Occurs sometime after calculation of the workbook set associated with the workbook view control has completed.

remarks.para: The event occurs sometime after calculation of the workbook set associated with the workbook view control has completed.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CellBeginEdit
member.summary: Occurs when edit mode is being initiated.

remarks.para: The event occurs when edit mode is being initiated, and provides the event handler with the ability to modify the text to be edited or cancel edit mode.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CellCancelEdit
member.summary: Occurs when edit mode is being canceled and provides the ability to force edit mode to continue by cancelling the event.

remarks.para: The event occurs when edit mode is being canceled, and provides the event handler with the ability to force edit mode to continue.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.CellEndEdit
member.summary: Occurs when edit mode is ending and provides the ability to force edit mode to continue by cancelling the event.

remarks.para: The event occurs when edit mode is being ended, and provides the event handler with the ability to modify the text to be placed into the , or force edit mode to continue.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeChanged
member.summary: Occurs sometime after an property setter or method changes one or more of the cells in the range.

remarks.para: It is important to note that some actions, such as insert or delete, will change cells outside of the range, and possibly even modify formulas in other worksheets or workbooks.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeSelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the range selection changes.

remarks.para: This event also occurs when the active tab is changed.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.RangeSelectionChanging
member.summary: Occurs when the user is attempting to change the range selection and provides the ability to cancel the change.

remarks.para: This event does not occur when the active tab is about to change.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ScrollPositionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the scroll position changes.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ShapeAction
member.summary: Occurs when a shape action happens.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ShapeSelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs after the shape selection changes.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ShapeSelectionChanging
member.summary: Occurs when the user is attempting to change the shape selection and provides the ability to cancel the change.

remarks.para: The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.

member.name: E:SpreadsheetGear.Windows.Controls.WorkbookView.ShowError
member.summary: This event is sent to the active WorkbookView just before an error message is to be displayed to the user.

remarks.para: The event is sent to the active WorkbookView just before an error message is to be displayed to the user, and provides the event handler with the ability to modify the error message text and caption or handle the event.
The event is always invoked on the thread which created the workbook view control, and a lock is always acquired on the workbook set associated with the workbook view control before is invoked.
